section.name: DataCite
section.definition: A published dataset referenced by a DOI and registered with DataCite. The referenced dataset will contain either the odML file itself or the data the odML is annotating.

property.name: language
property.definition: The primary language of the resource. Allowed values are taken from IETF BCP 47, ISO 639-1 language codes.Examples: en, de, fr

property.name: identifierType
property.definition: The type of Identifier.

property.name: identifier
property.definition: The Identifier is a unique string that identifies a resource. For software, determine whether the identifier is for a specific version of a piece of software, (per the Force11 Software Citation Principles), or for all versions. DOI (Digital Object Identifier) registered by a DataCite member. Format should be “10.1234/foo”

property.name: resourceTypeGeneral
property.value: [Audiovisual, Collection, DataPaper, Dataset, Event, Image, InteractiveResource, Model, PhysicalObject, Service, Software, Sound, Text, Workflow, Other]

property.name: subject
property.definition: Subject, keyword, classification code, or key phrase describing the resource.

property.name: subjectScheme
property.definition: The name of the subject scheme or classification code or authority if one is used.

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the subject identifier scheme.

property.name: valueURI
property.definition: The URI of the subject term.

section.name: dates
section.definition: Different dates relevant to the work.

property.name: date
property.definition: YYYY,YYYY-MM-DD, YYYY-MM-DDThh:mm:ssTZD or any other format or level of granularity described in W3CDTF24. Use RKMS-ISO860125standard for depicting date ranges.Example: 2004-03-02/2005-06-02.Years before 0000 must be prefixed with a -sign,e.g. -0054 to indicate 55 BC.

property.name: dateType
property.definition: The type of date. If Date is used, dateType is mandatory.
property.value: [Accepted, Available, Copyrighted, Collected, Created, Issued, Submitted, Updated, Valid, Withdrawn, Other]

property.name: dateInformation
property.definition: Specific information about the date, if appropriate.

section.name: size 1
section.definition: Size (e.g. bytes, pages, inches, etc.) or duration (extent), e.g. hours, minutes, days, etc., of a resource.

section.name: description 1
section.definition: All additional information that does not fit in any of the other categories. May be used for technical information.

property.name: descriptionType
property.definition: The type of the Description. If Description is used, descriptionType is mandatory.

section.name: rights
section.definition: Any rights information for this resource. The property may be repeated to record complex rights characteristics.

property.name: rightsURI
property.definition: The URI of the license.

property.name: rightsIdentifier
property.definition: A short, standardized version of the license name.

property.name: rightsIdentifierScheme
property.definition: The name of the scheme.

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the rightsIdentifierScheme.

section.name: alternateIdentifier
section.definition: An identifier or identifiers other than the primary Identifier applied to the resource being registered. This may be any alphanumeric string which is unique within its domain of issue. May be used for local identifiers. AlternateIdentifier shouldbe used for another identifier of the same instance (same location, same file).

property.name: alternateIdentifierType
property.definition: The type of the AlternateIdentifier. If alternateIdentifier is used, alternateIdentifierType is mandatory.

section.name: relatedIdentifier
section.definition: Identifiers of related resources. These must be globally unique identifiers.

property.name: relatedIdentifierType
property.definition: The type of the RelatedIdentifier
property.value: [ARK, arXiv, bibcode, DOI, EAN13, EISSN, Handle, IGSN, ISBN, ISSN, ISTC, LISSN, LSID, PMID, PURL, UPC, URL, URN, w3id]

property.name: relationType
property.definition: Description of the relationship of the resource being registered (A) and the related resource (B).
property.value: [IsCitedBy, Cites, IsSupplementTo, IsSupplementedBy, IsContinuedBy, Continues, IsDescribedBy, Describes, HasMetadata, IsMetadataFor, HasVersion, IsVersionOf, IsNewVersionOf, IsPreviousVersionOf, IsPartOf, HasPart, IsReferencedBy, References, IsDocumentedBy, Documents, IsCompiledBy, Compiles, IsVariantFormOf, IsOriginalFormOf, IsIdenticalTo, IsReviewedBy, Reviews, IsDerivedFrom, IsSourceOf, IsRequiredBy, Requires, IsObsoletedBy, Obsoletes]

property.name: relatedMetadataScheme
property.definition: The name of the scheme. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/IsMetadataFor)

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the relatedMetadataScheme. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/IsMetadataFor)

property.name: schemeType
property.definition: The type of the relatedMetadataScheme, linked with the schemeURI. Use only with this relation pair: (HasMetadata/IsMetadataFor)

property.name: resourceTypeGeneral
property.definition: The general type of the related resource.

section.name: fundingReference #
section.definition: Information about financial support (funding) for the resource being registered.

property.name: funderName
property.definition: Name of the funding provider.

property.name: funderIdentifier
property.definition: Uniquely identifies a funding entity, according to various types.

property.name: funderIdentifierType
property.definition: The type of the funderIdentifier.
property.value: [Crossref Funder ID, GRID, ISNI, ROR, Other]

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the funder identifier schema.

property.name: awardNumber
property.definition: The code assigned by the funder to a sponsored award (grant).

property.name: awardURI
property.definition: The URI leading to a page provided by the funder for more information about the award (grant).

property.name: awardTitle
property.definition: The human readable title or name of the award (grant).

section.name: contributor
section.definition: The institution or person responsible for collecting, managing, distributing, or otherwise contributing to the development of the resource.To supply multiple contributors, repeat this property.For software, if there is an alternate entity that "holds, archives, publishes, prints, distributes, releases, issues, or produces" the code, use the contributorType "hostingInstitution" for the code repository.

property.name: contributerType
property.value: [ContactPerson, DataCollector, DataCurator, DataManager, Distributor, Editor, HostingInstitution, Producer, ProjectLeader, ProjectManager, ProjectMember, RegistrationAgency, RegistrationAuthority, RelatedPerson, Researcher, ResearchGroup, RightsHolder, Sponsor, Supervisor, WorkPackageLeader, Other]
property.definition: The type of contributor of the resource.

property.name: contributorName
property.definition: The full name of the contributor.

property.name: givenName
property.definition: The personal or first name of the contributor.

property.name: familyName
property.definition: The surname or last name of the contributor.

section.name: namedIdentifier #
section.definition: Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.

property.name: namedIdentifier
property.definition: Value of the named identifier

property.name: nameIdentifierScheme
property.definition: The name of the name identifier scheme. Examples: ORCID, ISNI, ROR, GRID

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

section.name: affiliation #
section.definition: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the contributor.

property.name: affiliation
property.definition: Value of the affiliation

property.name: affiliationIdentifier
property.definition: Uniquely identifies the organizational affiliation of the contributor.

property.name: affiliationIdentifierScheme
property.definition: Name of the affiliation identifier schema. Examples: ROR, GRID

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: URI of the affiliation identifier schema.

section.name: creator #
section.definition: The main researchers involved in producing the data, or the authors of the publication, in priority order. To supply multiple creators, repeat this property.

property.name: creatorName
property.definition: The full name of the creator.

property.name: creatorNameType
property.definition: The type of name

property.name: givenName
property.definition: The personal or first name of the creator.

property.name: familyName
property.definition: The surname or last name of the creator.

section.name: namedIdentifier #
section.definition: Uniquely identifies an individual or legal entity, according to various schemes.

property.name: namedIdentifier
property.definition: Value of the named identifier

property.name: nameIdentifierScheme
property.definition: The name of the name identifier scheme. Examples: ORCID, ISNI, ROR, GRID

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: The URI of the name identifier scheme.

section.name: affiliation #
section.definition: The organizational or institutional affiliation of the creator.

property.name: affiliation
property.definition: Value of the affiliation

property.name: affiliationIdentifier
property.definition: Uniquely identifies the organizational affiliation of the creator.

property.name: affiliationIdentifierScheme
property.definition: Name of the affiliation identifier schema. Examples: ROR, GRID

property.name: schemeURI
property.definition: URI of the affiliation identifier schema.

section.name: DataCiteComplement
section.definition: Additional sections complementing the Datacite scheme. The information contained in this section is not supported by the DataCite scheme.

section.name: Reference #
section.definition: A publication the published dataset is referencing.

property.name: DOI
property.definition: DOI to the referenced publication

property.name: RefType
property.definition: refType might be: IsCitedBy, IsSupplementTo, IsReferencedBy, IsPartOf for further valid types see https://schema.datacite.org/meta/kernel-4

property.name: PublictionCitation
property.definition: Full citation of the reference publication
